oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Non-commissioned officer's sword
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Model 1840 non-commissioned officer's sword carried by James Blackwell and originally owned by his uncle, John Blackwell. Manufactured by R & C. James Blackwell served as a private and was later promoted to ensign with Co. K, 21st Miss. Inf. Regt., CSA. His brother, Nicholas, was a captain in the same company.
